clinical_study.official_title: Hypotension Relationship With Pleth Variability Index In Hip Fracture Patients Who Underwent Spinal Anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock: Correct assessment of a patient's volume status is the most important goal for an anesthetist. However, most of the variables used for fluid response evaluation are invasive and technically challenging.Pulse oximeter is a non-invasive, standardized and widely used monitoring method in many countries. Our aim in this study is to investigate the usefulness of the noninvasive pleth variability index to predict hypotension in orthopedic hip fracture patients who underwent spinal anesthesia.

secondary_outcome.measure: pleth variability index response to fluid management
Make a differential diagnosis of hypotension with pleth variability index
Correlation between arterial hemoglobin and pleth variability index hemoglobin

study_pop.textblock: Patients who underwent spinal anesthesia for hip fracture

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- over 65 years old
- Patients to undergo spinal anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients under 65 years old
- Patients to undergo general anesthesia or only sedation
- Patients with cardiac arrhythmia
- Patients with low ventricular ejection fraction
- Heart valve disease patients
